#Text=CanadaVOTES : NDP incumbent Wayne Marston running in Hamilton East — Stoney Creek
#Text=Thursday , September 25 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=New Democratic Party incumbent Wayne Marston
#Text=is standing for re-election in the riding of Hamilton East — Stoney Creek .
#Text=Marston ran in the former federal riding Hamilton East three times , in 1993 and 1997 election and 1996 by-election , losing to prominent Liberal Shelia Copps .
#Text=Prior to his winning election campaign in 2006 , Marston was President of the Hamilton and District Labour Council , serving for 11 years .
#Text=He was also a School Board Trustee ( Ward 5 ) for the Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board from 2000 to 2006 .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Wayne , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=This riding consists of the part of the Hamilton lying north of the Niagara Escarpment and east of Ottawa Street .
#Text=It was formed in 2003 from parts of the old ridings Hamilton East and Stoney Creek .
#Text=Wanting to take Marston 's seat from his are Liberal Larry Di Ianni , Green David William Hart Dyke , and Conservative Frank Rukavina .
#Text=A candidate from the newly formed Progressive Canadian party , Gord Hill , as well as independent Sam Cino are also running .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why did you choose to run for office , and why do you wish to continue as an MP ?
#Text=Forty years ago , I moved to Hamilton .
#Text=I 've lived and worked there ever since .
#Text=I quickly became involved in the union and held many positions over the years .
#Text=In 1995 I retired from Bell Canada and served as the President of the Hamilton and District Labour Council for 11 years .
#Text=During this time , we saw growth and then we saw the loss of good paying manufacturing jobs .
#Text=This scarred our community .
#Text=Hamilton is a city that has so much potential .
#Text=Unfortunately , we saw the loss of thousands of good paying that could have supported a family ; and no one stepped up to help us .
#Text=I wanted to give something back to this amazing community which has helped me raise my children and grandchildren , so in 2000 , I decided to get involved in politics .
#Text=I realized that our families needed more than empty promises from their elected representatives .
#Text=This led me to run in 2006 as the NDP 's candidate in the federal election .
#Text=I have strived to ensure that my office works for its community , cares and brings fairness and honesty to Canadians .
